description: Does what it does, nothing else.
esta bien la informacion que muestra sin muchas vueltas, lo unico que le faltaria es que se pudiera configurar para que se muestra en la barra de tareas las mediciones.

My current computer motherboard already has the places labeled, so this program tells me the values. Post a question on askubuntu.com on how to convert temp to Fahrenheit from Celsius....soon to be answered (i hope).

WAS answered in 2hrs. open terminal and type xsensors -f to display the GUI in Fahrenheit

the program doesn't allow you to change anything as it has no settings boxes to customize it. but WORKSSS just the same.
summary: great for monitoring temps and fans!

description:
Incorrect Temp Indication, no fan speed or voltage indicators. 
Operating System: Kubuntu 20.04
KDE Plasma Version: 5.18.5
KDE Frameworks Version: 5.68.0
Qt Version: 5.12.8
Kernel Version: 5.4.0-54-generic
OS Type: 64-bit
Processors: 4 × AMD FX(tm)-4130 Quad-Core Processor
Memory: 14.6 GiB of RAM
 Sorry, no prize here

I am sure laptop will vary cpu speedor voltage, this is not shown
I do sometimes hear the fans ramp up but this gives no indication of fan existence never mind speed. Maybe part of the issue is trialling this on a laptop.

It updates the temperature about every second, and will toggle between one of two temperatures. No config to display both, or vary the sampling frequency.

I also note debians Software app lists this under a find for "hardware" but it does not give a hit under a search for "sensor" maybe the app description is missing some relevant metadata.
summary: Only shows temperature. Maybe issue is my laptop hardware

description: This add does what I want, a simple interface where I can see temprature of all peripherals in one screen. Kudos to the dev team.
summary: Awesome, this is what I want

description: Die App präsentiert sich unter Kubuntu sehr übersichtlich und zeigt auf meinem Lenovo T430s die Temperatur der beiden Cores und die Spannung des Akkus. Wünschenswert wäre noch eine Hilfe, z.B. was "acpitz" genau ist. Ferner würde ein graphischer Verlauf der Messwerte noch einen Mehrwert liefern.
